si.t: This document was exported from Numbers. Each table was converted to an Excel worksheet. All other objects on each Numbers sheet were placed on separate worksheets. Please be aware that formula calculations may differ in Excel.

r.t: Uses of the system that are subject to a legal restriction, list them here and the likelihood that the system would not meet requirements.
- Robot could be used outside of a secure environment
- Robot could be asked to perform tasks that endanger humans

si.t: Ensure there is a failsafe that overrides unsafe instructions. Be mindful of who you are selling your product to (e.g., defense and army contractors)

r.t: Potential uses for which the system was not designed or evaluated or that should be avoided, list them here and the likelihood that this usecase would occur.
- Robot could be used to perform new tasks not covered in its original training with unexpected consequences

si.t: Train the model on edgecases. Implement a failsafe where the system shuts down if it is going to harm someone or some thing, regardless of it that is part of its ask.
Sensitive Uses – Consequential impact on legal position or life opportunities

r.t: Scenarios where the use or misuse of the AI system could affect an individual’s: legal status, legal rights, access to credit, education, employment, healthcare, housing, insurance, and social welfare benefits, services, or opportunities, or the terms on which they are provided.
- Improper use can result in harm to humans, animals or property

si.t: This is where a failsafe mechanism would be useful.
Sensitive Uses – Risk of physical or psychological injury

r.t: Scenarios where the use or misuse of the AI system could result in significant physical or psychological injury to an individual.
- Improper use can result in harm to humans

si.t: This is where a failsafe mechanism would be useful, where it is hard-coded in the system that any ask that requires directly or indirectlty harming humans or animals, should be ignored.

r.t: Scenarios where the use or misuse of the AI system could restrict, infringe upon, or undermine the ability to realize an individual’s human rights. (Note: because human rights are interdependent and interrelated, AI can affect nearly every internationally recognized human right.)
- Robot could be used as a guard to prevent humans from escaping
Describe the known limitations of the system. This could include scenarios where the system will not perform well, environmental factors to consider, or other operating factors to be aware of.

- Actual limitations will depend on specific sensors and training of the robot, but risks are generally related to operating outside of the functional range of its sensors, in environments that the robot has not be trained for and to perform tasks that can't be properly generalized from the training received by the robot

si.t: Create a system that is as generalizable as possible. Obtain training data in a variety of different scenarios, weather conditions, times of year, and with different sensors.
Relationships – Supply chain, customers, and partnerships

r.t: Describe vulnerabilities associated with the company's relationships including supply chain, customers, vendors, and strategic partnerships.

- Creating a physical robot that is good replica of its digital twin (requried if we assume learning will take place in a virtual space) is a complex and costly task, often requiring global supply chains which may be exposed to social & ethical risks.

si.t: Ensure the sensitive information is encrypted when stored, and ensure cloud security. Ensure that any partners or contractors we work with adhere to the same ethical and social guidelines as we do.

r.t: Describe vulnerabilities associated with the company's management team including track record, diversity in skillsets, as well as considerations for diversity, equity, and inclusion, and codifying decision-making processes.
- No data
Max
Initial
risk
Max
Remaining
risk

si.t: Managed by routine mitigation; covered in normal procedures
No or insignificant risk to assets and personnel, and/or low negative impact on stakeholders or company
Somewhat insignificant risk to assets and personnel, and/or some negative impact on stakeholders or company
Meaningful risk to assets and personnel, and/or negative impact on stakeholders or company
Life threatening risk and/or critical negative impact on stakeholders or company

r.t: Describe any industry-specific regulatory considerations where the AI technology is being applied and consider the company's capacity for compliance with industry-specific regulations, e.g. HIPAA.
- None known
Describe regulatory requirements for the operating jurisdiction and consider the company's capacity for compliance.

This may include compliance with data protection and privacy regulations, such as GDPR and CCPA; liability and accountability for AI decisions and actions; intellectual property, including copyright and patent infringement risks.
- Regulation is limited to Safety in the Workplace regulation
- Insurance may introduce additional restrictions

si.t: Ensure employees have access to programs for Safety in Workplace awareness.
Meets requirements; managed by routine mitigation; covered in normal procedures
May meet requirements; requires specific mitigation and caution
Unlikely to meet requirements; immediate action required
No or insignificant risk to assets and personnel, and/or low negative impact on company
Somewhat insignificant risk to assets and personnel, and/or some negative impact on company
Meaningful risk to assets and personnel, and/or negative impact on company
Life threatening risk and/or critical negative impact on company

r.t: Describe risks associated with the data requirements with respect to the system’s intended uses, stakeholders, and the geographic areas where the system will be deployed. (Note: omit regulatory consideration and include on the "Industry-Specific and Regulatory" tab.)
- Good-quality RL environments for training the robot are available
- CV model in a construction environment is still risky as there is a lot of variability depending on cluttering, wheather, standard safety practices, signaling, etc.

si.t: Must follow recognized safety practices when collecting data in a warehouse/construction zone. Must look into CV models for semi-static and dynamic environments.

r.t: Describe technology readiness – the likelihood the system is
not
supported by research and has
not
been deployed to production systems at scale for similar uses and the associated impact on users and stakeholders.
- Similar models have been implemented, but generally in narrower domains and/or controlled environments

si.t: Perform research and literature review on what models are out there for such environments.

r.t: Describe the task complexity – the likelihood that there will be a
high number of features
as well as
difficult interpretability
and complexity in setting boundaries for classification categories, etc. and the associated impact on users and stakeholders.
- There is compounded challenges here with at least 2 sophisticated systems providing feedback into each other.

si.t: A thorough review on what has already been achieved, should be performed, in order to build on such existing robotics and CV frameworks.
Models & infrastructure – Energy and environmental considerations

r.t: Describe the likelihood for large energy consumption and other considerations focused on environmental impacts linked to model training and inference and the associated impact at large.
- Unlikely to be a primary concern as the model is expected to be trained centrally.

si.t: Carbon footprints and emissions are important to consider when incoporating new features in the model.

r.t: Describe any additional potential risks pertaining to specifically to third party auditability of systems and models and community inclusion.
- These families of systems can be built with reasonable auditability and traceability.
Describe any risks or vulnerability associated with scaling, adapting, and maintaining the technology including existential risk as a product of scale and its impact at large.
- As the environment changes, the likelihood of dataset shift increases. This risk will depend on how controlled the environment is.

si.t: Scaling the systems may need re-train the models and it would impact the controlled environment.
